I have completed a research project on "Characterization of MDR Enterococcus species of animal, human and environmental origin with special emphasis on vancomycin resistance", as a part of my Master's thesis. I have hands-on experience in Microbiological techniques (isolation and identification of bacteria), Molecular Biology Techniques (DNA Isolation, RNA Isolation, Polymerase chain reaction), Basic immunological techniques, antimicrobial resistance characterization techniques (by PCR and qPCR), Bioinformatics (Genetic Diversity studies by ERIC and REP PCR techniques) and basic statistical techniques (SPSS and basics in R-studio). Previously worked as a senior research fellow in the project titled "Modelling exposure to biological hazards in the dairy chains of Andhra Pradesh to inform food safety policy". It was supervised by Javier Guitian and Dr. Tumati Srinivasa Rao (The Royal Veterinary College (RVC) and NTR College of veterinary science collaborated on the project. - 2021 [Prevalence of -lactamase Producing Shiga 2021 -lactamase genes among enterobacteriaceae members from local vended ice creams sold at different parts of Andhra Pradesh]() - 2019 [Occurrence and genetic diversity of ESBL producing Klebsiella species isolated from livestock and livestock products]() - 2019 [Multidrug resistance and ESBL profile of Salmonella serovars isolated from poultry birds and foods of animal origin]() - 2018 [Isolation, Molecular Characterization and Antimicrobial Resistance Patterns of Four Different Vibrio Species Isolated from Fresh Water Fishes]() - 2017-2019 Master of Veterinary ScienceSri Venkateswara - Mailing Address: - College of Veterinary Medicine University of Florida P.O. Mailing Address: - PO BOX 1110880 GAINESVILLE FL 326110001 - Physical Address: - 2015 SW 16TH AVE GAINESVILLE FL 32608 Vinicius was awarded a Doctorate of Veterinary Medicine from Universidade Federal de Goiás, Brazil in 2016. Vinicius' expertise encompasses broad aspects of avian pathology and microbiology, including diagnostics, disease pathogenesis, and treatment. Current research interests focus upon evaluating the efficacy of live recombinant attenuated Salmonella vaccines against priority poultry pathogens. Specifically, Vinicius' aims to control Campylobacter jejuni, avian coli, Clostridium perfringens, Listeria monocytogenes and Salmonella spp. - Graduate School funding Award2019-2023 · University of Florida - Latin American/Caribbean Scholarship2017-2018 · University of Florida - Scientific Initiation Scholarship2014-2016 · Universidade Federal de Goiás - 2011-2016 Doctor of Veterinary MedicineCollege of Veterinary Medicine, Federal University of Goiás [Dorothea V Megarani](https://directory.ufhealth.org/megarani-dorothea) [dorotheamegarani@ufl.edu](mailto:dorotheamegarani@ufl.edu) - Mailing 110880 GAINESVILLE FL 32611 - 2022 Diseases of Aquatic Organisms - 2020 [The Method of Total Erythrocyte and Leukocyte Counting in Raptors at Wildlife Rescue Centre (WRC) Jogja]() - 2020 [Comparative Morphology and Morphometry 2020 [Genetic characterization and phylogenetic study of Indonesian indigenous catfish based on mitochondrial cytochrome B gene.](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/32158157) - 2017 [Horses Working in Therapeutic Programs: Cortisol, Adrenocorticotropic Hormone, Glucose, and Behavior Stress Indicators]() - 2015-2017 Masters in Public HealthUniversity of Missouri - 2013 Doctor of Veterinary MedicineUniversitas Gadjah Mada, Indonesia [Nicole M OF V2-228 2015 SW 16th GAINESVILLE FL 32608 - 2021 Viruses - Sep 2021 ACTIVE RDT-undetectable Malaria in the DR Congo: Epidemiology and Development of Alternatives: DRC Diversity SupplementUNIV OF NORTH CAROLINA CHAPEL HILL · Other - 2015 MS in Environmental HealthUniversity of Puerto Rico, Medical Science Campus - 2007 Bachelor's in Industrial MicrobiologyUniversity of Puerto Rico, Mayaguez Campus [Na Sun](https://directory.ufhealth.org/sun-na) [sun.na@ufl.edu](mailto:sun.na@ufl.edu) 110880 GAINESVILLE FL 32611 - [Stephen M Mwalimu](https://directory.ufhealth.org/mwalimu-stephen) [smwalimu@ufl.edu](mailto:smwalimu@ufl.edu) - Mailing Address: - 2015 SW 16th Ave COLLEGE OF VET. Physical - Florida 2030 SHEALY DR GAINESVILLE FL 32608 Brucellosis in Livestock in Rwanda, Africa Brucellosis is a disease that can cause abortion and reduced milk yield in cattle, as well as fever and chronic fatigue in humans. Socio-economic consequences of Brucella spp. infections include forced unemployment and cost of treatment in infected people, reduced family livestock-related income, as well as interruption of trade in animals and animal products. Vaccination or test-and-slaughter are cost-effective control interventions in high-income countries (e.g., USA). As part of my PhD research, I will assess and compare the costs and benefits of adopting control interventions (vaccination, test-and-slaughter, versus a status-quo scenario) to reduce the burden of brucellosis in livestock in Rwanda; a low-income country with 13 million people and 1.3 million cows. My research will inform policy makers on the socio-economic consequences of acting, or failing to act, on policy options of selected intervention scenarios in livestock populations in Rwanda. - Disease Modeling - National University of Córdoba, Córdoba, Argentina. - 2001-2006 Doctor GAINESVILLE FL 32610 - Physical Address: - 2015 SW 16TH AVE GAINESVILLE FL 32608 - Embryonic Development - Animal Reproductive Biotechnologies - Animal Reproductive Physiology - Assisted reproduction techniques - Biology of reproduction (embryo development, maintenance of pregnancy, and genetic control of reproduction) [Segundo Casaro](https://directory.ufhealth.org/casaro-segundo) DVM, MS [segundocasaro@ufl.edu](mailto:segundocasaro@ufl.edu) - Mailing Address: GAINESVILLE FL 32610 - Physical Address: - 2030 SHEALY DR GAINESVILLE FL 32611 I completed my DVM degree in 2018 at the University of La Plata College of Veterinary Medicine in Buenos Aires, Argentina. After graduation, I worked for one year as a beef and dairy cattle veterinary practitioner, mostly doing reproductive and nutrition related activities. Then, in June 2019, I had the privilege of being accepted as a Research Scholar in the Department of Large Animal Clinical Sciences at the University of Florida under the supervision of Dr. Klibs Galvão. After completing a year as a Research Scholar, I was accepted into the Animal Molecular and Cellular Biology Master of Science graduate program, also under the supervision of Dr. Galvão. I graduated from the master's program in July 2021. Right upon graduation I was granted the admission to the PhD program in Veterinary Medical Sciences through the Department of Large Animal Clinical Sciences at the University of Florida's College of Veterinary Medicine for Fall term 2021 under the guidance of Dr. Klibs Galvão. Since my arrival at the University of Florida as a Research Scholar, and currently during the PhD program I am working closely with Dr. Galvão aiming to develop a statistical model capable of predicting metritis in dairy cows - Mailing Address: - Molecular PO Box 100245 GAINESVILLE FL 32610 - Physical Address: - 100116 GAINESVILLE FL 32610 - Physical Address: - 2015 SW 16TH AVE GAINESVILLE FL 32608 Francesca was born and raised in Marin County, CA. She attended Cal Poly in San Luis Obispo for her undergraduate degree, where she received her B.Sc in Animal Science with a minor in Biology in 2016. After obtaining her degree, Francesca left San Luis Obispo to continue her veterinary education at the UC Davis School of Veterinary Medicine. She graduated from UC Davis in May 2020 with her DVM. Francesca completed a small animal rotating internship at Iowa State University in June 2021. She is now a Master's Student in the College of Veterinary Medicine at the University of Florida, and will be starting as a small animal surgical resident at the University of Florida College of Veterinary Medicine in July 2022. Her particular interests include surgical oncology, minimally invasive surgery, interventional radiology, and academia. - Phi Zeta Honors Society2020 · Society of Phi Zeta Lambda Chapter - Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM)AAVSB -
